properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 8 at 8:26PM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
Several rounds of heavy rainfall are expected between Monday and
Thursday as a series of disturbances interact with a stalled
frontal boundary. Thunderstorms are also expected during this time
and will locally increase rainfall amounts. The combination of
saturated soils from recent rainfall, and many rivers, creeks, and
streams still recovering, will increase the threat for flooding.
Flash flooding is also possible during heavy downpours.

Rainfall totals Monday and Tuesday could reach 2 to 3 inches,
with another 2 to 3 inches possible Wednesday and Thursday. It is
important to note that these values may change depending on
exactly where the front stalls.

A Flash Flood Watch or Areal Flood Watch may be required for
portions of northern Alabama and southern middle Tennessee next
week. Residents should continue to monitor this unfolding weather
situation over the holiday weekend and stay tuned to further
forecast updates from the National Weather Service.

For additional hydrologic information, visit our website at
weather.gov/huntsville.

NWSheadline: Flooding and Flash Flooding Possible Monday through Thursday across the Tennessee Valley
